instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3478: What is 820-3478? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Fan spins no chime Black screen
threads.message:
i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which Fan spins but don't chime and only black screen
first 2 LED lights up,
CPU Vcore 1.7V
GPU Vcore 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V
no shorts detected 

is this GPU issue? resistance on gpu core is 20ohms same goes to CPU as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Fan spins no chime Black screen
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you try SMC reset?
Can also test disconnecting CMOS cell.

Try known good BIOS, before GPU reflow (for test).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Fan spins no chime Black screen
threads.message:
no history other than it just suddenly died.
yes tried SMC reset as well.
i thought <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> signal indicates that BIOS loadout is complete and CPU is talking to EFI? anyway i will try finding for the a clean BIOS first
